Class DecryptedMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • DecryptedMessage

  • public class DecryptedMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main decryption class for this library. Its constructor takes in 2 arguments into the class. It has two methods decryptMessage and toString. The toString method is the only publicly available method and it does the decryption and returns the decrypted message as a string.
    Author:
    Tanner Brunscheon

    • Field Detail

      • ALPHABET

        private final char[] ALPHABET
        This is the string of characters used in the encryption and decryption software. All words must only have characters in this array or spaces. This is the "Index".

      • messageStr

        private java.lang.String messageStr
        The message as a string to be decrypted.

      • key

        The key that decrypts the message.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecryptedMessage

        public DecryptedMessage(java.lang.String messageStr,
                        int[] key)
        This constructor takes in message string and an array of ints as the decryption key. It also error checks the key to make sure the key matches the length of the message.
        Parameters:
        messageStr - Message to decrypt
        key - Decryption key

    • Method Detail

      • decryptMessage

        private void decryptMessage()
        This is the primary class of the DecryptedMessage. This class uses the variables stored in the object and the key to decrypt the message. It does so by taking the index number of the letter in the encrypted message and adds the key to it. If this results in looping because the index number ends up below 0, it adds 36 to simulate the looping. 36 being the size of the index. It also ignores decryption if it sees the next character being a space.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        ToString is the return method in the DecryptedMessage class. It calls decrypt message and formats the decrypted output into a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The decrypted message as a string.
